description: Borrowed from Middle French récipé, from Latin recipe, second person singular imperative of Latin recipiō (“receive”). Compare receipt.

entries.meaning: (medicine, archaic) A formula for preparing or using a medicine; a prescription; also, a medicine prepared from such instructions. [from 16th c.]
Any set of instructions for preparing a mixture of ingredients. [from 17th c.]
By extension, a plan or procedure to obtain a given end result; a prescription. [from 17th c.]
examples: His new approach is definitely a recipe for success.

entries.meaning: Now especially, a set of instructions for making or preparing food dishes. [from 18th c.]
A set of conditions and parameters of an industrial process to obtain a given result.
